text: I want to say a few words about the
situation in Syria as you've seen today
we've released our unclassified
assessment detailing with high
confidence that the Syrian regime
carried out a chemical weapons attack
that killed well over a thousand people
including hundreds of children this
follows the horrific images that shocked
us all this kind of attack is a
channeling through the world we cannot
accept the world where women and
children and innocent civilians are
gassed on a terrible scale this kind of
attack threatens our national security
interests by violating well established
international norms against the use of
chemical weapons by further threatening
friends and allies of ours in the region
like Israel and Turkey and Jordan and it
increases the risk that chemical weapons
will be used in the future and fall into
the hands of terrorists who might use
them against us so I have said before
and I meant what I said that the world
has an obligation to make sure that we
maintain the norm against the use of
chemical weapons now I have not made a
final decision about various actions
that might be taken to help enforce them
north but as I've already said I have
had my military and our team look at a
wide range of options we have consulted
with allies we consulted with Congress
been in conversations with all the
interested parties and in no event are
we considering any kind of military
action that would involve boots on the
ground that would involve a long
campaign but we are looking at the
possibility of a limited narrow act that
would help make sure that not only Syria
but others around the world understand
that the international community cares
about maintaining this chemical weapons
ban and normal again I repeat we're not
considering any open-ended commitment
we're not considering a boots on the
ground approach what we will do is
consider options that meet the narrow
concern around chemical weapons
understanding that there's not going to
be a solely military solution to the
underlying conflict and tragedy that's
taking place in Syria and I will
continue to consult closely with
Congress in addition to the release of
the unclassified document we are
providing a classified briefing to
congressional staffs today and we'll
offer that saying classified briefing to
members of Congress as well as our
international partners and I will
continue to provide updates to the
American people as we get more
information
